intro: Delphinium sierrae-blancae subsp. amplum, commonly known as the Sierra White delphinium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a distinctive hairy texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
